Course Title:		Advanced English Conversation  
Credit Hours:		2
Instructor’s Name:	Dr. Yun-Hua Yang
Contact E-Mail:	yhyang@ntut.edu.tw 
Term Offered:		Fall, 2017
Scheduled Class Hours: Thursday 1:10—3:00 PM
Office Hours:      By appointment 
Required Texts:  N/A
Course Description: In today’s world, one of the essential skills to expand one’s social and career network is to establish relationship through effective communication, including verbal and non-verbal forms. This course will look at the process of both forms of communication, with a particular emphasis on language use, skills, strategies and relationship building. A variety of discourse types, areas of topics, fields of work and scenarios will be included in the training.  
Course Objectives:  This course aims to help learners of English to
			(1) build confidence in conversational communication in English 
			(2) give organized, coherent, and focused spoken messages in English 
            (3) employ effective strategies (skills and techniques) to persuade and obtain committed actions
schedule:
Wk 1: Orientation 
Wk 2-6: Topic-based communication: individual talks 
Wk 7-12: Situational communication: conversational tasks
Wk 13-18: Debates and discussions
scorePolicy:
Course Requirements:
(1)	Students are required to give a three-minute talk in each class session. Topics will be assigned in advance. 
(2)	Students will be randomly invited to comment on other student speakers’ talks. A brief Q & A session will be conducted.  
(3)	All talks, including comments and Q&A discussions will be recorded. Every two weeks, students need to submit the recording of a revised talk and an analytical reflection of  what to do in order to “repair” the previous communication. Submit both the recording and written analysis. All reflective analysis will be read and discussed in class. 
(4)	Attendance: Students are required to attend class as scheduled. 
i.	Each unexcused absence will result in 10% semester grade deduction. 
ii.	At the sole discretion of the instructor, absence penalty may be waived with valid proof and just cause. Penalty waiver request will only be accepted in two weeks of the date of absence. It is important to know that generally only ONE- time penalty waiver will be considered.  
iii.	Lateness to class: Any arrival to class after the instructor finishes the second-round roll call is considered lateness. Each occasions of lateness will, in effect, incur a grade penalty of 5% semester grade deduction.
Evaluation Procedures & Grading System:
	Final grades will be determined by a point system (X out of 100 total points). Students will be evaluated as follows: (1) Individual talks, comments, and reflections 50-60% (TBD) (2) Attendance 30%   (3) Simulation of situational communications10-20% (TBD)
